other_tests.findings: A large neck mass measuring 6.0 x 3.8 x 2.1 cm and weighing 24.8 g was resected, revealing a benign parathyroid adenoma consisting primarily of oxyphil cells that stained positive for PTH.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Twelve hours postoperatively, serum calcium fell to 5.9 mg/dl and PTH dropped to 8 pg/ml. By four days post-surgery, serum calcium increased to 8.2 mg/dl. Two months post-surgery, serum calcium remained low at 7.4 mg/dl, and PTH at 151 pg/ml. Bone turnover markers were elevated at two months and normalized by eight months postoperatively. Bone mineral density increased dramatically, with cumulative increases of 51% at the lumbar spine and 36% at the total hip by one year post-surgery.

other_tests.findings: A well-encapsulated and nonadherent parathyroid mass measuring 4.7 x 3.0 x 1.0 cm weighing 7.1 g was resected, showing a benign oxyphil cell adenoma that stained positively for PTH.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Four days after surgery, serum calcium was 8.5 mg/dl. The patient was lost to follow-up after discharge.
